Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice or heavy chalice; discoloured white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; added red band above added white band; exterior: from top, confronted felines (front leg of each remaining); dotted square and elaborate rosette as filling ornament; two dilute lines; upper part of lion’s head and neck, to left, with part of its tail on far right; pendant triangle and dotted square as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Since the sherd is quite thick, it may have come from a heavy chalice
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 256, no. 457, pl. 61) (Incorrectly labelled as 1888.6-1.472.l.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1337) (phase 2)
